citations.narrative:
In approximately 20 rabbit enclosures, a rabbit in the enclosure exceeded the individual weight in the Animal Welfare Act
for the amount of floor space provided. The enclosures provided 14"x32"=3.11 square feet of space and the recorded
weights exceeded 4.0 kgs, documented by the facility during weekly weight checks as recently as the week before (22
March), and as early as mid February. Adequate floor space is necessary to allow the rabbits to make normal postural
and social adjustments with adequate freedom of movement. Each rabbit weighing more than 4 kgs shall be provided with
4.0 square feet of floor space.
Correct by 15 April, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager.
n

narrative:
3.53(c)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In approximately 20 rabbit enclosures, a rabbit in the enclosure exceeded the individual weight in the Animal Welfare Act 
for the amount of floor space provided. The enclosures provided 14"x32"=3.11 square feet of space and the recorded 
weights exceeded 4.0 kgs, documented by the facility during weekly weight checks as recently as the week before (22 
March), and as early as mid February. Adequate floor space is necessary to allow the rabbits to make normal postural 
and social adjustments with adequate freedom of movement. Each rabbit weighing more than 4 kgs shall be provided with 
4.0 square feet of floor space. 
 
Correct by 15 April, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager. 
 
 n
